Journey to Nowhere and Oblivion Ring get rid of it, for reasons Lollercoaster describes.
I tell you a funny way to deal with it, though.
Block with Tidehollow Strix

Big bad Emrakul dies to a 2/1..... lol!

@ugbootz: How does Stone Idol Trap help? Emrakul has flying

@Ah_MaclimesZero: "Spell" is the keyword you're looking for. Once a permanent is on the battlefield, it's not longer a spell, hence, he has no protection from Tidehollow Strix or any other creature. Same goes for O'ring and Journey to Nowhere, at the time their abilities resolve they're permanents, not spells, which is why they are some of the most effective ways of getting rid of Emrakul.
Before you start having a go at me go learn what a "spell" is.

@Revelation666: For crying out loud, LEARN WHAT A SPELL IS.
O'ring and Journey's abilities activate as they enter the battlefield, when they're PERMANENTS, not spells. A card is only a spell whilst it... (see all)

posts.post_content:
Does anybody remember when Darksteel Colossus and Phyrexian Dreadnought were considered to be some of the most powerful creatures ever printed (not efficient necessarily, just really big and powerful).  
  
These make them look like nothing.  
Kozilek and Ulamog are most likely more powerful than Colossus, and they cost roughly the same.  
And there is no contest for Emrakul.  
  
The worst thing is, as things stand in Standard, you'll be seeing Kozilek and Ulamog turn 5-6, and Emrakul only 2-3 turns later (if you survive that long).  
  
You'll be seeing them turn 3 or sooner in Extended with Hypergenesis Cascade.

posts.post_content: These legendary Eldrazi are wreaking my favourite deck style (which is mill/control). I like them though. An uncounterable [Time Warp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time Warp) with a major wreaking ball body and multiple murderous abilities is always awesome. I have found that a well timed [Telemin Performance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Telemin Performance) can turn the tides of the game and maybe a [Mindbreak Trap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mindbreak Trap) can be profitable. Also I have used [Gather Specimens](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gather Specimens) to get my opponents big guys. [Sadistic Sacrement](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sadistic Sacrement) could work, especially if its kicked.

Posted By: Demonic_Angel13 (4/20/2010 4:56:14 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
After freaking out for a little while about how unfair this card looks, I began to realize three things.
  
   
1) Hardly anyone will ever be able to hard cast this, so time walking doesn't matter.
  
   
2) Even with protection, several things will stop this card from a simple oblivion ring or journey to nowhere, to drana or kalitas bloodchief ability. It can still die to wrath's/day of judgement, and sac. affects like consuming vapors, so maybe not as hard to get rid of as it seems.
  
   
3) I can win the game before this ever sees play, in extended there's already several turn 3 wins (hyper gen really didn't need this card since it worked already), and in standard aggro creatures kill an opponent before they have 15 mana.
  
   
All in all, I am more impressed by ulamog, with his basic indestructibility, and enter play vindication/maelstrom pulse. Plus he is more cost efficient.
posts.html:
After freaking out for a little while about how unfair this card looks, I began to realize three things.

1) Hardly anyone will ever be able to hard cast this, so time walking doesn't matter.

2) Even with protection, several things will stop this card from a simple oblivion ring or journey to nowhere, to drana or kalitas bloodchief ability. It can still die to wrath's/day of judgement, and sac. affects like consuming vapors, so maybe not as hard to get rid of as it seems.

3) I can win the game before this ever sees play, in extended there's already several turn 3 wins (hyper gen really didn't need this card since it worked already), and in standard aggro creatures kill an opponent before they have 15 mana.

All in all, I am more impressed by ulamog, with his basic indestructibility, and enter play vindication/maelstrom pulse. Plus he is more cost efficient.

Posted By: MrQuizzles (5/5/2010 5:48:49 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This won't stop a mill deck, if that player uses [Tormod's Crypt](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Tormod's Crypt), [Relic of Progenitus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Relic of Progenitus), or hell, even [Walking Atlas](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Walking Atlas) a [Bojuka Bog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Bojuka Bog) onto the battlefield in response to Emrakul's 'put into graveyard' triggered ability. I also love [Extirpate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Extirpate), the split second guarantees that Emrakul will not be making an appearance. Any instant speed graveyard removal will stop the Eldrazi, though the triggered ability still resolves and they shuffle their graveyard into their library, but at least it won't happen indefinitely.  
And before anyone argues this, the Eldrazi will be in the graveyard when the ability triggers. The above cards remove the graveyard (or just the one card) before the player shuffles, but after the creature is in the graveyard.
posts.html:
This won't stop a mill deck, if that player uses Tormod's Crypt, Relic of Progenitus, or hell, even Walking Atlas a Bojuka Bog onto the battlefield in response to Emrakul's 'put into graveyard' triggered ability. I also love Extirpate, the split second guarantees that Emrakul will not be making an appearance. Any instant speed graveyard removal will stop the Eldrazi, though the triggered ability still resolves and they shuffle their graveyard into their library, but at least it won't happen indefinitely.
And before anyone argues this, the Eldrazi will be in the graveyard when the ability triggers. The above cards remove the graveyard (or just the one card) before the player shuffles, but after the creature is in the graveyard.

posts.post_content:
Rather balanced dude imho. It got powerful abilities, but on the other hand  
- "on cast" triggers are worse than "on entering the battlefield"  
- can't be reanimated  
- can't be cheated into play (if you want the extra turn)  
- costs insane amounts of mana  
  
For the same amount of mana, you could [fireball](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=fireball) someone for 14 damage. :)  
  
And why do people say it will stop mill decks dead in their track? I mill your deck, you have only emrakul left, I play [sign in blood](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=sign in blood) on you and you lose, Emrakul won't change that.
posts.html:

- "on cast" triggers are worse than "on entering the battlefield"

posts.post_content: In Reply to Asinine-Ultimatum, Your opponent couldn't have moved their prison term onto your Emrakul, Emrakul has protection from colored spells, meaning: "702.14c A permanent or player with protection can't be enchanted by Auras that have the stated quality. Such Auras attached to the permanent or player with protection will be put into their owners' graveyards as a state-based action." They would have lost their Prison Term, and you could have won!!

posts.post_content:
People seem to be acting like the sky is freaking falling with this card, or indeed any of the other Eldrazi.   
  
If you're hard casting this thing, you've pretty much won. But the thing about that is, if your opponent lets you get 15 mana in the first place, I'd be amazed if you *didn't* win through some means.  
  
Cheating it into play works, but if your opponent lets, say, an elvish piper resolve, and lets it last long enough for it to lose summoning sickness, they *deserve* to lose.  
  
One valid complaint about this card in particular is that it completely destroys mill decks by simply being in the library.  
  
This card isn't the end of MtG, it isn't the worst thing that Wizards has ever done, a lot of you people need to unbunch your panties and realize that this is just another giant fatty that will never be hard-casted outside of casual play and RoE limited/constructed.  
  
As for the card itself, I like it, my inner Timmy loves huge beasts like this, for 15 mana, you're pretty muc... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
